intro: Lastrea brackenridgei, commonly known as the Brackenridge's lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and high temperatures. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of succulent plants.
